Hi All,
New to APIs, so apologies if this has already been covered. I want to start using HubSpot tracking and their cookie consent mechanism. But it doesn't support the management of third party cookies.
I've been told the Event API can be used to pass on consent outcome to trigger the Google Tag Manager script - which is what I use to deploy my third party cookies. Has anyone successfully done this and can guide me through? So far my attempts to configure this have been largely unsuccessful.
I'm relying on these resources, but have yet to solve this issue:
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/cookie-banner>
• <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/GDPR/HubSpot-Google-Tag-Manager-and-cookie-consent/m-p/488151>
• <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/cookie-tracking-in-banner-with-GA/m-p/271193>
can a VID be updated or appended when trying to backfill VIDs for contacts that came over via API without them?

Hi everyone,

I am trying to use change subscriberState for an external event. I am receiving a weird response back from the API.

```{'category': None,
'context': None,
'correlation_id': None,
'errors': None,
'links': None,
'message': None,
'sub_category': None}```

When I then get the data for the external event I do not see the registered participant.

I am using the python library and my code looks like this
```from HubSpot import HubSpot
from HubSpot.marketing.events.exceptions import ApiException
from HubSpot.marketing.events.models.batch_input_marketing_event_email_subscriber import BatchInputMarketingEventEmailSubscriber

import time

api_client = HubSpot()
api_client.access_token = 'xxxxx'


#format time to unix time for HubSpot API
reg_datetime = int(time.time_ns() / 1000 )
print(reg_datetime)

externalAccountID = xxxx
externalEventID = xxx

subscriber_state = "register" 

#set the email and interaction date for subscribers
inputs = [{"interactionDateTime":reg_datetime,"email":"<mailto:cosmin@testing.com|cosmin@testing.com>"}]
contact_inputs = BatchInputMarketingEventEmailSubscriber(inputs)


try:
   mktevent_substate = api_client.marketing.events.subscriber_state_changes_api.do_email_upsert_by_id(externalEventID,subscriber_state, externalAccountID, contact_inputs )
except ApiException as e:
   print("Exception raised: %s\n" % e)
print(mktevent_substate)

#Verify change
get_external_event = api_client.marketing.events.basic_api.get_by_id(externalEventID, externalAccountID)
print(get_external_event)```

Can anyone figure out if I’m doing something wrong?
